title: French Sénat approves bill to make abortion a constitutional 'freedom'
summary: The conservative-dominated Sénat, with 267 votes to 50, approved the bill to constitutionalize abortion as a 'guaranteed freedom.' President Emmanuel Macron will call a joint session of Parliament on March 4 for a final vote on the reform.

title: Supreme Court, moving swiftly, agrees to hear Trump's presidential immunity appeal
summary: Donald Trump is the first prominent presidential candidate in US history to pursue reelection amidst a whirlwind of numerous civil, criminal, and legal inquiries and court proceedings. America's highest court scheduled oral arguments in the high-stakes case for the week of April 22.

title: Israeli soldiers deployed in Gaza post their abuses on social media
summary: The service members operating in the Palestinian enclave brag about their exploits on TikTok or Instagram. The stream of videos showing humiliations, looting and destruction attest to the sense of impunity that drives them.

title: French PM suggests 'Putin's troops are already in our country,' pointing at Le Pen
summary: Heated exchanges broke out in Parliament between Prime Minister Gabriel Attal and far-right leader Marine Le Pen, following Emmanuel Macron's statement that sending Western troops to Ukraine should 'not be ruled out.'

title: DRC: 'The European Union is complicit in the plundering of our resources and the aggression of Rwanda'
summary: Christophe Lutundula, the Congolese Minister of Foreign Affairs, is calling for international sanctions against Kigali, accusing it of supporting the rebel movement M23.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: What's planned for athletes' children
summary: Several female participants asked to be allowed to keep their babies close to them during the Games. The French Olympic and Paralympic committees clarified the measures they are putting in place.

title: US lawmakers reach tentative deal, averting government shutdown
summary: The US Congress approved temporary funding measures on Wednesday, safeguarding the operations of several crucial federal agencies and preventing the potential furlough of thousands of employees.

title: Richard Lewis, acclaimed comedian, 'Curb Your Enthusiasm' actor, dies at 76
summary: With his trademark black attire and unruly shock of hair, Lewis brought a unique blend of self-deprecation and existential angst to the comedy stage.

title: More than 20 migrants dead in shipwreck off Senegal coast
summary: Senegal's coasts are an increasingly common departure point for African migrants heading to the Spanish Canary Islands, their port of entry into Europe.

title: Macron defends idea of potentially sending troops to Ukraine as allies distance themselves
summary: The French presidency said Tuesday that the question had been raised during calls with other Western leaders ahead of the Paris conference where Macron said 'no option should be ruled out.'

title: Frontex did not issue Mayday call ahead of Greece shipwreck in which 650 migrants died
summary: A report by European Ombudsman Emily O'Reilly examines the EU border agency's shortcomings during the disaster in June 2023. She criticizes its lack of cooperation with Greece and floats the idea of suspending its activities in certain cases.

title: Women's Nations League: World champions Spain beat France 2-0
summary: Two goals by Spain's Aitana Bonmati and Mariona Caldentey clinched the trophy for the World Champions in Seville.

title: Hop away? Paris deals with unwelcome rabbits at Les Invalides
summary: The animal protection association Paris Animaux Zoopolis is concerned by the police's decision to remove the European rabbits that have taken up residence on the monument's lawns and are accused of contributing to soil collapse.

title: Ghana's parliament passes anti-LGBTQ+ rights bill
summary: The controversial bill, which would impose 3-to-5 year jail terms for people advocating for LGBTQ+ rights. Proposed by the opposition, it still has to be validated by President Nana Akufo-Addo, who has previously spoken out against gay marriage.

title: French prosecutors widen rape probe on former star news anchor 'PPDA'
summary: The rape investigation against Patrick Poivre d'Arvor, following his indictment in December 2023, was widened to include 3 more cases of rape or sexual assault, out of 23 other testimonies of women who have accused him of sexual abuse or harassement.

title: Video: Why a ground offensive in Rafah would be devastating
summary: The town's population has increased fivefold with the arrival of over a million Gazans displaced by the war. The city is also in the sights of the Israeli army, which considers it to be Hamas' last stronghold.

title: Detained French journalist overstepped accreditation, says Ethiopian government
summary: Antoine Galindo, who has been detained since February 22, had traveled to Ethiopia to cover the African Union summit earlier this month for the specialist publication Africa Intelligence.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: Investigation opened after engineer loses USB containing Paris traffic plans
summary: An engineer employed by Paris City Hall reported to police that he had misplaced his bag at Paris' Gare du Nord train station. According to prosecutors, the key contained no sensitive security information.

title: War in Ukraine: Ursula von der Leyen suggests using Russian assets frozen in Europe to arm Kyiv
summary: The European Commission President has proposed seizing the interest generated by the 200 billion euros from the Central Bank of Russia, frozen within the territory of the Twenty-Seven to purchase military equipment for Ukraine.

title: Pascal Canfin: 'Through its anti-environmental ideology,  the far-right undermines any efforts that could contribute to the establishment of European sovereignty'
summary: In an op-ed for 'Le Monde,' MEP Pascal Canfin points out that in the European Parliament, far-right parties consistently vote against climate-related measures, even though the adopted texts aim to combat the scourges they denounce.

title: Narges Mohammadi: In Iran, 'women lead the strongest civil disobedience actions'
summary: The Iranian Nobel Peace Prize winner answered Le Monde's questions on women's rights in Iran today, from Evin prison, near Tehran.

title: Paris inaugurates Olympic Village made of four new neighborhoods in northern suburbs
summary: Constructed on a 52-hectare site straddling three towns, the buildings that will host athletes at the next Olympic and Paralympic Games are due to be inaugurated on Thursday, February 29.

title: Amidst UK's dental care crisis, Brits opt for DIY solutions
summary: Unable to afford private dental care or wait "three years" for an appointment with a dentist from the NHS, 63-year-old Caroline Pursey resorted to pulling out twelve teeth with pliers.

title: Hamas in its entirety is a 'terrorist entity,' according to New Zealand
summary: The island country also imposed sanctions on approximately a dozen "extremist Israeli settlers," who stand accused of perpetrating violence against Palestinians.

title: Trump kicked off Illinois primary ballot over January 6 role
summary: Donald Trump's campaign vowed to appeal the decision.

title: Dutch six-year mega-trial puts three drug cartel members in jail for life
summary: Seventeen members of the drug-trafficking group involved in killings were given sentences ranging from life to one year and eight months.

title: French national railway company reaps significant benefits from fully booked high-speed lines
summary: With a record number of passengers, the company has sustained profitability for the third consecutive year. Despite substantial investments, there are currently no intentions to reduce prices.

title: US Supreme Court agrees to hear Trump's immunity claim, delaying January 6 trial
summary: It's possible that the federal trial over Trump's involvement in the January 6 insurrection won't start before the presidential election.

title: US Senate Republican leader Mitch McConnell to step down in November
summary: McConnell, 82, has been the longest-serving Senate Republican leader in American history. In his tenure, he battled Obama's policies from 2015, supported Trump in 2017 – only to fall out with him in 2020 – and was an outspoken supporter of US aid to Ukraine.

title: Strasbourg terror attack: Four men on trial over shooting that left 5 dead in 2018
summary: One of those on trial is accused of terrorism after helping Cherif Chekatt shoot five people in less than 10 minutes at a Christmas market in the center of Strasbourg in 2018.

title: Macron turns to Qatar for greater influence in the Middle East
summary: The emir of Qatar's state visit to France this week rekindled relations between the two countries. Emmanuel Macron and Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani called for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza and continued support for the Lebanese army.

title: France one step closer to enshrining abortion 'freedom' in Constitution after Sénat vote
summary: Emmanuel Macron has announced that a joint session of Parliament will be held on March 4, which will have to vote with a three-fifths majority to confirm the constitutionalization of the right to abortion.

title: French actress Judith Godrèche denounces sexual violence in parliamentary hearing
summary: The actress, who has become a leading figure in France's #MeToo movement after speaking out about sexual violence in the film industry, was the first to have even been heard by the Sénat on these issues.
